body.p:
His Excelency
The Govenor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Your Petitioner would respectfully represent unto Your Exelency that at the March Term 1861. he was found guilty and fined Thirty dollars on an Indictment for an assault in the Bath Circuit Court. Under such circumstances as he was unable to explain owing to the absence of any person that could explain. the whole circumstances under which the assault was made. Your petitioner states most positively that he only acted in self defence & was compeled to do. who he did. purly in self defence and that he is a poore man scarsly able to make a support for his wife & children he would therefore ask your exelency to remit said fine in duty bound will ever pray.
May 25th 1861

We the undersigned citizens of Bath County would state to your Excelency that we are well acquainted with Mr Hanson Coffer the above petitioner & some of us have a knowledge of the facts & circumstances attending his case, that he is an honest industrious man with a large family and from all we know and believe we think his case require executive clemency. and would therefore ask a remission of the fine

A. Trumbo
